{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[William the Conqueror]] and his army set sail from the mouth of the [[Somme River]], beginning the [[Norman Conquest of England]].
*[[1331]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Płowce]] between the [[Kingdom of Poland of the later Piasts|Kingdom of Poland]] and the [[Teutonic Order]] is fought.
*[[1422]] &ndash; After the brief [[Gollub War]] the [[Teutonic Knights]] sign the [[Treaty of Melno]] with the [[Poland during the Jagiellon dynasty|Kingdom of Poland]] and [[Grand Duchy of Lithuania]]
*[[1529]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Vienna]] begins when [[Suleiman I]] attacks the city.
*[[1540]] &ndash; The [[Society of Jesus]] (the [[Jesuits]]) receives its [[charter]] from [[Pope Paul III]].
*[[1590]] &ndash; [[Pope Urban VII]] dies 13 days after being chosen as the [[Pope]], making his reign [[List of 10 shortest-reigning Popes|the shortest papacy in history]].
*[[1605]] &ndash; The armies of [[Sweden]] are defeated by the [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth]] in the [[Battle of Kircholm]].
*[[1669]] &ndash; The [[Republic of Venice|Venetians]] surrender the fortress of [[Heraklion|Candia]] to the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottomans]], thus ending the 21-year long [[Siege of Candia]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[Lancaster, Pennsylvania]] is the capital of the [[United States]], for one day.
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Mexico]] gains its independence from [[Spain]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; [[Jean-François Champollion]] announces that he has deciphered the [[Rosetta stone]]. 
*[[1825]] &ndash; The world's first public railway to use steam locomotives, the [[Stockton and Darlington Railway]], is ceremonially opened.
*[[1854]] &ndash; The [[steamship]] ''[[SS Arctic]]'' sinks with 300 people on board. This marks the first great disaster in the [[Atlantic Ocean]].
*[[1875]] &ndash; The merchant sailing ship ''[[Ellen Southard]]'' is wrecked in a storm at [[Liverpool]]; the [[United States Congress]] subsequently awards 27 gold [[Lifesaving Medal]]s to the lifeboat men who went to rescue her crew.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Wreck of the Old 97]], a train crash made famous by the song of the same name.
*[[1905]] &ndash; The physics journal [[Annalen der Physik]] received [[Albert Einstein]]'s paper "Does the Inertia of a Body Depend Upon Its Energy Content?", introducing the equation [[E=mc²]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; The first production of the [[Ford Model T]] [[automobile]] was built at the [[Piquette Plant]] in [[Detroit, Michigan]]. 
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[Iyasu V of Ethiopia|Iyasu]] is proclaimed deposed as ruler of [[Ethiopia]] in a palace coup in favor of his aunt [[Zauditu of Ethiopia|Zauditu]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Constantine I of Greece|King Constantine I]] of [[Greece]] abdicates his throne in favor of his eldest son, [[George II of Greece|King George II]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; The [[Republic of China]] is recognized by the [[United States]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Bobby Jones (golfer)|Bobby Jones]] wins the [[United States Amateur Championship (men's golf)|U.S. Amateur Championship]] to complete the [[Grand Slam (golf)|Grand Slam]] of golf. The old structure of the grand slam was the [[U.S. Open (golf)|U.S. Open]], [[The Open Championship|British Open]], [[United States Amateur Championship (men's golf)|U.S. Amateur]], and [[The Amateur Championship|British Amateur]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; [[Balinese Tiger]] declared extinct.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Ocean liner]] ''[[RMS Queen Elizabeth|Queen Elizabeth]]'' launched in [[Glasgow]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Tripartite Pact]] is signed in [[Berlin]] by [[Germany]], [[Japan]] and [[Italy]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; The ''[[SS Patrick Henry]]'' is launched becoming the first of more than 2,700 [[Liberty ship]]s.
*[[1942]] &ndash; Last day of the September [[Actions along the Matanikau (September – October 1942)|Matanikau action]] on [[Guadalcanal]] as [[United States Marine Corps]] troops barely escape after being surrounded by [[Empire of Japan|Japanese]] forces near the [[Matanikau River]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Bombing of Kassel in World War II|Kassel Mission]] results in the largest loss by a [[United States Army Air Forces|USAAF]] group on any mission in [[World War II]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; The first Plenary Session of the [[National People's Congress]] approves the design of the [[Flag of the People's Republic of China]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; The nationwide debut of ''[[Tonight Starring Steve Allen]]'' ''(The Tonight Show)'' hosted by [[Steve Allen]] on [[NBC]]. 
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[USAF]] Captain [[Milburn G. Apt]] becomes the first man to exceed [[Mach number|Mach]] 3 while flying the [[Bell X-2]]. Shortly thereafter, the craft goes out of control and Captain Apt is killed.
*[[1959]] &ndash; Nearly 5,000 people die on the main [[Japan]]ese island of [[Honshū]] as the result of a [[typhoon]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Sierra Leone]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Yemen Arab Republic]] is established.
*[[1964]] &ndash; The British [[BAC TSR-2|TSR-2]] aircraft XR219 makes its maiden flight from [[Boscombe Down]] in [[Wiltshire]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; The stage [[Musical theatre|musical]] ''[[Hair (musical)|Hair]]'' opens at the [[Shaftesbury Theatre]] in [[London]], where it played 1,998 performances until its closure was forced by the roof collapsing in [[July]] [[1973]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; A [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] [[McDonnell Douglas F-4 Phantom II]] [[1977 Yokohama F-4 crash|crashes into a residential neighborhood]] in [[Yokohama, Japan]], killing two children on the ground and injuring seven other people.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of Education]] receives final approval from the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] to become the 13th US [[Cabinet (government)|Cabinet]] agency.
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Richard Stallman]] announces the [[GNU]] project to develop a free [[Unix-like]] [[operating system]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[National League for Democracy]] is formed by [[Aung San Suu Kyi]] and various others to help fight against [[dictatorship]] in [[Myanmar]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; The [[Sukhumi massacre]] takes place in [[Abkhazia]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; In [[Afghanistan]], the [[Taliban]] capture the [[capital city]] [[Kabul]] after driving out [[President]] [[Burhanuddin Rabbani]] and executing former leader [[Mohammad Najibullah]].
*  1996   &ndash; The [[Julie N.]] tanker ship crashes into the [[Million Dollar Bridge (Maine)|Million Dollar Bridge]] in [[Portland, Maine]] spilling thousands of gallons of oil.
*[[1997]] &ndash; Communications are suddenly lost with the ''[[Mars Pathfinder]]'' space probe.
*[[1998]] &ndash; The [[Google]] internet [[search engine]] retrospectively claims this as its birthday.
*[[2000]] &ndash; The first Olympic Gold Medal ever for [[Tae Kwon Do]] was won by [[Greece|Greek]] athlete [[Michalis Mouroutsos]] in men's -58&nbsp;kg division in [[Sydney]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Zug massacre]]: In Zug, Switzerland, Friedrich Leibacher shoots 18 citizens, killing 14 and then himself.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[East Timor|Timor-Leste]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Smart 1]] satellite is launched.
*[[2005]] &ndash; After 162 episodes, ''[[Tom and Jerry]]'' airs its final episode titled, ''[[The Karate Guard]]''.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[NASA]] launches the ''[[Dawn (spacecraft)|Dawn]]'' probe.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[China National Space Administration|CNSA]] astronaut [[Zhai Zhigang]] becomes the first [[China|Chinese]] person to perform a spacewalk while flying on ''[[Shenzhou 7]]''.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[2012 Minneapolis workplace shooting|mass shooting]] takes place at Accent Signage Systems, in [[Minneapolis]], [[Minnesota]], killing 6 people, including the gunman who committed suicide, and wounding 2 others.
